name: py-gtdbtk

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
GTDB-Tk is a software toolkit for assigning objective taxonomic
classifications to bacterial and archaeal genomes based on the Genome
Database Taxonomy (GTDB).

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-dendropy
dependencies.description:
DendroPy is a Python library for phylogenetic computing. It provides
classes and functions for the simulation, processing, and manipulation
of phylogenetic trees and character matrices, and supports the reading
and writing of phylogenetic data in a range of formats, such as NEXUS,
NEWICK, NeXML, Phylip, FASTA, etc.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-pydantic
dependencies.description: Data validation and settings management using Python type hinting.

dependencies.name: prodigal
dependencies.description: Fast, reliable protein-coding gene prediction for prokaryotic genomes.

dependencies.name: hmmer
dependencies.description:
HMMER is used for searching sequence databases for sequence homologs,
and for making sequence alignments. It implements methods using
probabilistic models called profile hidden Markov models (profile HMMs).

dependencies.name: pplacer
dependencies.description:
Pplacer places query sequences on a fixed reference phylogenetic tree to
maximize phylogenetic likelihood or posterior probability according to a
reference alignment. Pplacer is designed to be fast, to give useful
information about uncertainty, and to offer advanced visualization and
downstream analysis.

dependencies.name: fastani
dependencies.description:
Fast, alignment-free computation of whole-genome Average Nucleotide
Identity (ANI)

dependencies.name: fasttree
dependencies.description:
FastTree infers approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees from
alignments of nucleotide or protein sequences.

dependencies.name: mash
dependencies.description: Fast genome and metagenome distance estimation using MinHash.
